channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: This lawyer is fighting defamation lawsuits that can silence sexual assault victims
item.description: Since the start of the #MeToo movement, many accused abusers have filed defamation charges against their accusers in retaliation, advocates say. Law professor Victoria Burke wants to change that.
item.content:encoded:
Since the start of the #MeToo movement, many accused abusers have filed defamation charges against their accusers in retaliation, advocates say. Law professor Victoria Burke wants to change that.

(Image credit: Mike Blout)
item.dc:creator: Jaclyn Diaz

item.title: In 2016, NPR talked to 2 young Hillary fans. How do they feel after this election?
item.description: Eight years ago, Hillary Clinton supporters gathered at her alma mater hoping to celebrate the election of first female U.S. president. We tracked down two of the tiniest fans to check back in.
item.content:encoded:
Eight years ago, Hillary Clinton supporters gathered at her alma mater hoping to celebrate the election of first female U.S. president. We tracked down two of the tiniest fans to check back in.

(Image credit: Image by)
item.dc:creator: Tovia Smith

item.title: Ann Patchett finds bits of Catholicism and America appalling: 'But I am those things'
item.description: Ann Patchett is owning her shortcomings. On Wild Card this week, she opens up about religion and the place that shaped her as much as any person did.
item.content:encoded:
Ann Patchett is owning her shortcomings. On Wild Card this week, she opens up about religion and the place that shaped her as much as any person did.

(Image credit: Emily Dorio)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Martin

item.title: How one Ukrainian chef is fighting for culinary independence
item.description: In a cookbook forged during the war with Russia, a Ukrainian celebrity chef uses cuisine to "continue the story of Ukraine."
item.content:encoded:
In a cookbook forged during the war with Russia, a Ukrainian celebrity chef uses cuisine to "continue the story of Ukraine."

(Image credit: Oksana Parafeniuk for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Joanna Kakissis

item.title: The story of White House 'trophy terms' offers a cautionary tale
item.description: The lessons of history about second-term presidents and second-term Republicans in particular are not just the stuff of textbooks. They can offer guidance and perhaps even temper expectations.
item.content:encoded:
The lessons of history about second-term presidents and second-term Republicans in particular are not just the stuff of textbooks. They can offer guidance and perhaps even temper expectations.

(Image credit: Chip Somodevilla)
item.dc:creator: Ron Elving

item.title: This 72-year-old retreat 'feels like another home' for Ukrainian Americans
item.description: The Soyuzivka Ukrainian Heritage Center, a resort that sits about two and a half hours northwest of New York City, in Kerhonkson, N.Y., provides a place that "feels like another home" for thousands of Ukrainian Americans every year.
item.content:encoded: The Soyuzivka Ukrainian Heritage Center, a resort that sits about two and a half hours northwest of New York City, in Kerhonkson, N.Y., provides a place that "feels like another home" for thousands of Ukrainian Americans every year.
item.dc:creator: Andrea Wenglowskyj

item.title: Slower winds aid firefighters battling destructive blaze in Southern California
item.description: Firefighters gained ground Saturday on a wildfire that has ravaged more than 100 structures as gusty winds subsided with favorable weather conditions expected through the weekend.
item.content:encoded:
Firefighters gained ground Saturday on a wildfire that has ravaged more than 100 structures as gusty winds subsided with favorable weather conditions expected through the weekend.

(Image credit: Ethan Swope)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Donald Trump wins Arizona
item.description: Arizona was that last state to be called by the Associated Press in the presidential race. It brings Trump's total electoral vote count to 312, with 226 for Vice President Harris.
item.content:encoded:
Arizona was that last state to be called by the Associated Press in the presidential race. It brings Trump's total electoral vote count to 312, with 226 for Vice President Harris.

(Image credit: Patrick T. Fallon)
item.dc:creator: Megan Pratz

item.title: The 2025 Grammy nominations are out. Here are the big takeaways
item.description: Stephen Thompson on the biggest surprises, trends and questions to be found in the Grammy nominations, plus the most interesting stories to be found beyond the major categories.
item.content:encoded:
Stephen Thompson on the biggest surprises, trends and questions to be found in the Grammy nominations, plus the most interesting stories to be found beyond the major categories.

(Image credit: Frazer Harrison)
item.dc:creator: Stephen Thompson

item.title: FEMA worker fired for telling hurricane responders to avoid homes with pro-Trump signs
item.description: FEMA's administrator said the employee told a team responding to hurricane survivors to skip homes with yard signs showing support for Donald Trump.
item.content:encoded:
FEMA's administrator said the employee told a team responding to hurricane survivors to skip homes with yard signs showing support for Donald Trump.

(Image credit: Rebecca Blackwell)
item.dc:creator: Emma Bowman
